item.title: Junior Expert in Agriculture/Agricultural Financial Services (Incl. Insurances)
item.author: Penny Buckle
item.description:
Final Evaluation of the Global Index Insurance Facility for ACP Countries Programme - GIIF

Junior Expert 3 (Category II, 80 WD):

  • a minimum of 6 years of professional experience in the field of agriculture/agricultural financial services (incl. insurances) in developing countries;
  • at least 2 years of experience in working in the field of agricultural financial services (incl. insurances)/agricultural risk management. Practical experience in (a) index insurance, (b) insurance product development and delivery, © insurances legal, regulatory and supervisory systems, preferably in developing countries, will be an asset.
  • a university degree in economics, agriculture/veterinary science with economics background or a comparable qualification.

Common features for the whole team:

  • a solid and diversified experience in development and cooperation projects management (minimum of 5 experiences in identification and/or design and/or implementation and/or evaluation of international co-operation programmes);
  • experience in developing countries (at least in 5 developing countries);
  • fully conversant with the principles and working methods of project cycle management and EC aid delivery methods (minimum of 5 experiences in identification and/or design and/or implementation and/or evaluation of international co-operation programmes);
  • fully conversant with monitoring and evaluation principles (logframe approach, results based management, etc.) (minimum of 3 experiences);
  • ability to work under pressure and to respect deadlines;
  • fully working knowledge of English;
  • good knowledge of French [missions foreseen in French speaking countries].

If you meet the requirements and would be interested in applying for this role please email your CV in EC format to veronica_hernandez-castilla@dai.com

Final Evaluation of the Global Index Insurance Facility for ACP Countries Programme - GIIF

Senior Experts in Agriculture/Agricultural Financial Services (Incl. Insurances) (one TL) (Category I, 20WD and 80 WD):

item.title: Key expert 4: Procurement Expert – Category II
item.author: Penny Buckle
item.description:
JASPERS - Support to preparation of Model Concession Agreement for InterModal Terminals

The overall objective of the project will be to develop a Draft Concession Agreement for the granting of rights to develop an Intermodal Terminal through a combination of grants and private finance, and to operate the facility on a commercial basis, with specified rights and procedures for future expansion of capacity or services provided.

Key expert 4: Procurement Expert – Category II

Qualifications and skills:

  • Postgraduate degree in finance, law or related field;
  • Fluency in English is required. Knowledge of Romanian is a distinct advantage.

General professional experience At least ten (10) years’ international experience in procurement activities for infrastructure.

Specific professional experience The candidate must be familiar with current Romanian and EU Laws relating to Procurement, and have international experience in procurement for PPP projects.

If you meet the requirements and would be interested in applying for this role please email your CV in EC format to veronica_hernandez-castilla@dai.com

item.title: Category II Trade Expert with Experience in the Pacific Region
item.author: Penny Buckle
item.description:
Mid-term Evaluation of the TRA II to Papua New Guinea

The global objective of this assignment is to verify, analyse and assess in detail the issues referring to the five evaluation criteria endorsed by the OECD-DAC (relevance, effectiveness, efficiency, impact and sustainability), and to the EU-specific evaluation criteria (EU added value and coherence) of the TRA (Trade Related Assistance) programme-Phase 2 in PNG and to provide lessons learnt and recommendations for a successful implementation of the programme.

Category II Trade Expert with Experience in the Pacific Region

Qualifications and skills:

  • The Expert must have at least a university degree in a relevant discipline (e.g. international trade, economics, law, social sciences or other field relevant to this contract).
  • The Expert must be fully proficient in written and spoken English.

General professional experience:

  • A minimum of 6 years of professional experience in international trade.

Specific professional experience:

  • A minimum of 3 demonstrated professional experiences in project evaluations and economic/social impact analysis;
  • A minimum of 3 years professional experience in developing countries;
  • A minimum of 3 demonstrated professional experiences in institutional capacity development;
  • Professional experience in the Pacific region will be considered an advantage;
  • Professional Experience with EDF procedures will be considered an advantage.

If you meet the requirements and would be interested in applying for this role please email your CV in EC format to Lina_Forgeaux@dai.com

item.title: Spécialisé dans la formation de journalistes en production de contenu radiophonique dédié aux jeunes sur le thème de l’éducation aux médias
item.author: Penny Buckle
item.description:
Appui a la radio algerienne pour la formation des journalistes radio a l'education aux medias

Objectifs généraux :

  • Renforcer la capacité des jeunes journalistes algériens à devenir des acteurs éclairés de la société de l’information et de la communication en développant leurs compétences de filtrage et de triage des messages médiatiques déversés à flot sur le net et en apprenant à utiliser et à produire un contenu médiatique dans une perspective critique tout en respectant l’éthique et les règles déontologiques professionnelles.
  • Renforcer les liens entre les jeunes citoyens et leur radio par le biais d’émissions sur l’éducation aux médias qui leur permettent d’acquérir une aptitude à déceler la différence entre nouvelles d’actualité, publicité

Objectifs particuliers:

  • Développer la capacité des jeunes journalistes algériens et leur fournir les outils nécessaires pour la recherche, la sélection, l’interprétation et le décryptage de l’information dans les médias électroniques et réseaux sociaux, ainsi que l’évaluation des différentes sources et contenus pour interagir sur les nouveaux médias de manière responsable et constructive.
  • Renforcer les capacités techniques des responsables des sites web de la radio algérienne.
  • Former les journalistes, producteurs et animateurs, responsables des émissions adressées aux jeunes dans les autres radios, à gérer le contenu des sites web de leurs radios respectives.
  • Organiser des plates-formes d’échange entre les médias et leurs jeunes auditeurs (programmes interactifs).
  • Produire et diffuser des programmes sur l’éducation aux médias.
  • Mettre à disposition en PodCast sur des émissions dédiées à l’« éducation aux médias » afin de sensibiliser les journalistes et un public plus large.

Expert 3 (Catégorie 1) Spécialisé dans la formation de journalistes en production de contenu radiophonique dédié aux jeunes sur le thème de l’éducation aux médias

Qualifications et compétences :

  • Titulaire d’un master en ingénierie de la formation journalisme/ communication ou tout diplôme ou expérience équivalent
  • Parfaite maîtrise, orale et écrite, de la langue française

Expérience professionnelle générale :

  • Au moins 12 ans d’expérience professionnelle (de préférence 15 ans) dans le domaine des médias.

Expérience professionnelle spécifique :

  • Au moins 5 ans (de préférence 7 ans) dans le domaine de la formation dans les médias.
  • Au moins 1 expériences (de préférence 3) dans le domaine de l’éducation aux médias.

Atouts supplémentaires

  • Avoir travaillé dans un pays du bassin méditerranéen
  • Connaissance de la langue arabe

If you meet the requirements and would be interested in applying for this role please email your CV in EC format to CorinaMaria_Campian@dai.com

WE ARE ONLY ABLE TO RESPOND TO CANDIDATES WHO MEET THE SPECIFICATIONS

Expert 2 (Catégorie 1) Spécialisé dans la formation des webmasters des sites radio

Qualifications et compétences :

  • Titulaire d’un master en ingénierie de la formation, journalisme/ communication ou tout diplôme ou expérience équivalent et pertinent pour la mise en oeuvre du présent contrat
  • Parfaite maîtrise, orale et écrite, de la langue française

Expérience professionnelle générale:

  • Au moins 12 ans d’expérience professionnelle (de préference 15 ans) dans le domaine des médias

*Expérience professionnelle spécifique *:

item.title: Two Senior Rural Development Experts (one TL)
item.author: Penny Buckle
item.description:
DINU Scoping

Global objective

The global objective of the assignment is to support the programme contracting authority (the Ugandan Ministry of Finance and Economic Development), the programme supervising authority (the Office of the Prime Minister) and the European Union to identify the specific geographical coverage of the programme and identify specific agriculture value chains of focus.

Specific objective

Create a body of evidence to support the development of a well-justified geographical coverage highlighting various possible scenarios where specific districts and value chains of focus are clearly identified. This will be done through a highly participatory process involving identified implementing partners, central MDA1 and decentralised authorities with a view of ensuring the buy-in of the plan by all stakeholders.

Two Senior Rural Development Experts (one TL)

The Team Leader will have the overall responsibility to provide guidance and leadership to the team of experts.

The Senior Consultant will support the undertaking of the scoping exercise with a substantive role in data collection and analysis as well as report drafting.

Minimum requirement:

  • Qualifications and skills: at least Master’s Degree in agriculture, economics, political sciences, engineering or a relevant, directly related discipline; in its absence, equivalent professional experience;

  • General professional experience: at least 12 years' experience in sector related to rural development (agriculture, livestock, rural engineering, decentralisation etc.)

  • Language skills: excellent communication skills in written and spoken English and proven ability to draft high quality reports and communication notes

Specific professional experience:

  • Experience in designing large and multi-sectorial rural development programmes
  • Understanding of development matters, preferably in Northern Uganda and Karamoja or in similar contexts characterised by high poverty rates, post-conflict environment and agriculture-based economies
  • Ability to analysis qualitative and quantitative data and perform the triangulation of mixed data sources
  • Ability to strategically interact with high level officials in view of finding compromises and reach consensus.

If you meet the requirements and would be interested in applying for this role please email your CV in EC format to CorinaMaria_Campian@dai.com

WE ARE ONLY ABLE TO RESPOND TO CANDIDATES WHO MEET THE SPECIFICATIONS

item.title: Team Leader and Evaluation Team, Evaluation of Budget Support in Cambodia 2011-2016
item.author: Penny Buckle
item.description:
Evaluation of Budget Support in Cambodia 2011-2016

The specific rationale for undertaking this evaluation is to assess to what extent budget support in Cambodia contributed to achieve its expected results, notably through giving means to the partner government to implement the country’s Education Sector Policy, and to enhance the efficiency and effectiveness of policies, strategies and spending actions, thus contributing to sustainable results on growth and poverty reduction. The evaluation should also analyse how budget support has contributed to strengthening Public Financial Management (PFM), to improving transparency within government and accountability.

The evaluation will also consider other aid modalities (basket/common funds, projects), in order to assess the complementarity and synergies with budget support operations. It should look into Monitoring and Evaluation systems (M&E) and the availability and credibility of data.

The evaluation will take stock of what has been achieved with the main purpose to allow for lessons learnt and recommendations to inform on:

  • the conditions under which budget support has an effect and the possible intensity and nature (positive or negative) of such effect in Cambodia;
  • the design and implementation of future budget support operations in Cambodia;
  • improvements to be set up by the European Union to maximize the impact of budget support in Cambodia;
  • constraints in government policies, institutional structures and administrative arrangements in Cambodia which might impede the overall effectiveness and impact on spending actions and targeted public policy, and therefore of budget support.

The Team Leader should have: strong experience of budget support modalities and budget support evaluation techniques, including an in-depth knowledge of the methodological approach for BS evaluations developed within the OECD/DAC framework; experience in managing complex evaluations; experience as team leader.

The Evaluation Team must have a thorough knowledge and experience with:

General qualifications:

  • development cooperation in general;
  • different evaluation methodologies for complex evaluations;
  • development cooperation in Cambodia;
  • English fluent

Within the team, thorough knowledge and experience is required with, adequacy for the assignment:

  • budget support modalities;
  • techniques for the evaluation of budget support;
  • macroeconomics;
  • public finance management;
  • education sector;
  • methods and techniques for rigorous impact evaluation.

Following experience is an advantage:

  • education sector in Cambodia;
  • development cooperation in Cambodia;
  • ability to read and speak Khmer

If you meet the requirements and would be interested in applying for this role please email your CV in EC format to lina_forgeaux@dai.com

WE ARE ONLY ABLE TO RESPOND TO CANDIDATES WHO MEET THE SPECIFICATIONS

item.title: Social Development Expert
item.author: Penny Buckle
item.description:
Strategic Approach for EU-Thailand Cooperation

The global objective of the assignment is to deliver a strategic approach for EU-Thailand cooperation that will contribute to Thailand’s achievement of sustainable development (SDGs), leading to reduced inequality and higher income status and at the same time demonstrating the impact and added-value of the EU contributions. Drawing lessons learned from EU relations with other upper middle income countries (such as Mexico, South Korea, Brazil), the specific objective of the study is to review and assess Thailand’s current state of development and the applicable EU instruments/initiatives and prepare a strategic approach for EU-Thailand cooperation in order to contribute to the political/policy dialogue and facilitate Thailand’s achievement of inclusive and sustainable development, in line with the country SDGs' commitments. The cross-cutting issues such as gender equality, good governance, and environmental sustainability will be taken into account in the approach that will be developed.

*Expert 2: Social Development expert, 30 w/d * *Qualifications and skills *

  • Advanced university degree (minimum Master’s Degree) in development studies, social development, certified by a Diploma (or equivalent professional experience of at least 9 years if candidate does not possess an advance university degree.);
  • S/he must possess facilitation and communication skills,
  • Excellent command of oral and written English
  • Ability to prepare and present well-written analytical documents
  • Computer literacy (minimum MS Word, PowerPoint, Excel)

General professional experience:

  • At least 6 years of experience in the domain of cooperation/development of strategies (social, environment, gender, multi-sectoral).
  • Up-to-date and comprehensive knowledge and demonstrated experience of EU development co-operation policies, instruments, and facilities

Specific professional experience:

  • Of the 6 years of general experience, at least 4 years are experiences in cooperation with upper middle income countries.
  • Minimum 3 experiences in development projects in ASEAN countries.
  • Experience in development context in Thailand is an asset

If you meet the requirements and would be interested in applying for this role please email your CV in EC format to elena_bellitto@dai.com

WE ARE ONLY ABLE TO RESPOND TO CANDIDATES WHO MEET THE SPECIFICATION

item.title: Team leader/Development Expert
item.author: Penny Buckle
item.description:
Strategic Approach for EU-Thailand Cooperation

The global objective of the assignment is to deliver a strategic approach for EU-Thailand cooperation that will contribute to Thailand’s achievement of sustainable development (SDGs), leading to reduced inequality and higher income status and at the same time demonstrating the impact and added-value of the EU contributions. Drawing lessons learned from EU relations with other upper middle income countries (such as Mexico, South Korea, Brazil), the specific objective of the study is to review and assess Thailand’s current state of development and the applicable EU instruments/initiatives and prepare a strategic approach for EU-Thailand cooperation in order to contribute to the political/policy dialogue and facilitate Thailand’s achievement of inclusive and sustainable development, in line with the country SDGs' commitments. The cross-cutting issues such as gender equality, good governance, and environmental sustainability will be taken into account in the approach that will be developed.

Expert 1: Team leader/Development Expert, 32 w/d

Qualifications and skills

  • Advanced university degree (minimum Master’s Degree) in the field of development economics, political economy, certified by a Diploma (or equivalent professional experience of at least 15 years if candidate does not possess an advance university degree.);

  • Excellent command of oral and written English
  • Ability to prepare and present well-written analytical documents

  • Knowledge of international agreements

Specific professional experience:

  • Of the 12 years of general experience, at least 8 years are experiences in cooperation with upper middle income countries.
  • Minimum 1 relevant experience in designing/formulating strategic framework for cooperation for the EU

item.title: Key expert C II: Monitoring and Evaluation – Results
item.author: Penny Buckle
item.description:
Mid-term evaluation MDTF Khyber Pakhtunkhwa, FATA and Balochistan 2016 and 2017

This assignment has as objective to contribute to the Annual Review of the MDTF 2016 and 2017. The overall objective of MDTF is to support the implementation of a programme reconstruction and development aimed at facilitating the recovery of the affected regions in the Khyber Pakhtunkhwa Province (“KP”), the Federally Administered Tribal Areas (“FATA”) and the Province of Baluchistan (“Baluchistan”) from the impact of: (i) the armed conflict and reducing the potential for escalation or resumption, and (ii) the floods of 2010.

Under the overall coordination of the Team Leader and in close cooperation with the other members of the AR evaluation team, the expert is expected to contribute to the overall review conducted by a team of experts specialised in complementary fields and provide quality inputs related to his expertise in the part “Monitoring and evaluation – results” and other areas as assigned. Key work stream will include:

  • How effective are the mechanisms in place for monitoring and evaluation and is the data required adequate, available in the format required and sufficiently robust.
  • Quality assure the output data available for the review and provide recommendations, as appropriate.
  • Analyse if the programme data sufficiently reflect its focus on poor and underserved areas, women, girls and children, and the requirements of the Gender Equality Act?

Project Duration: January 2017 - January 2018

Key expert C II: Monitoring and Evaluation – Results, 20 w/d

Qualifications and skills

  • Masters Degree in in business management or administration, development studies, economics, social science or any other relevant field or its absence, equivalent professional experience.
  • Strong skills in writing clear, well structured and concise reports.

General professional experience

  • A minimum of 6 years of experience in program management of programs in the governance sector

Specific professional experience

  • At least 3 years proven professional experience in monitoring and evaluation of development programs
  • At least 3 years professional experience in project cycle management and well versed in the use of the logical framework
  • Knowledge of recent developments in programme/project M&E;
  • Experience in evaluating complex development project/programmes, including in the fields of local or rural development and/or early recovery and rehabilitation desired
  • Experience in evaluation of Multi-donor programs, preferably Multi Donor Trust Funds and/or World Bank administered programs desired
  • Experience in evaluating projects using the DFID methodology and templates highly desired
  • Excellent communication and interpersonal skills and be able to work in a team

Language:

Excellent knowledge of English, spoken and written is a must, Urdu is an advantage.

The expert must be independent and free from conflicts of interest in the responsibilities he/she takes on.

If you meet the requirements and would be interested in applying for this role please email your CV in EC format to elena_bellitto@dai.com

WE ARE ONLY ABLE TO RESPOND TO CANDIDATES WHO MEET THE SPECIFICATIONS

item.title: Senior Assessors with Sector Experience and knowledge of EU External Aid Programmes
item.author: Penny Buckle
item.description:
Support to the evaluation of IPA II CSF ‘Regional Thematic Networks of CSOs’ Call for Proposals

Global objective To ensure adequate conditions to assess the call for proposals by providing the necessary technical assistance to the European Commission in the evaluation process.

Specific objective(s) To assist the Evaluation Committee in assessing the proposals received under this call for proposals for 84 man - days.

Senior Assessors with Sector Experience and knowledge of EU External Aid Programmes

The senior experts should have:

  • At least 10 years of experience and a Master’s Degree Academic level or, in the absence of the Master’s Degree Academic level, in total at least 15 years professional experience.
  • Extensive knowledge of the issues covered by the grant programme concerned in the specific domain (e.g. Education, Culture, Good Governance, Human Rights, Minorities and Vulnerable groups, Gender issues, Reconciliation, Philanthropy, Media Freedom, Environment and climate action, Social inclusion, etc.), notably as concerns support to Civil Society Organisations.

The team as a whole should have the following expertise:

  • Knowledge of the rules and procedures of EU external aid programmes and ideally supporting evidence of a recent practical experience in the evaluation of proposals submitted under EU external aid programmes
  • Good knowledge of EU and enlargement-related matters
  • Excellent oral and writing skills in English (level 1 in a scale from 1 to 5, where 1 is “excellent” and 5 is “basic” (Senior Experts)
  • Advanced understanding of democratization and civil society related issues
  • At least one amongst the senior experts should have at least 5 years of experience in evaluation and/ or management of programmes and/or projects financed by the Instrument for Pre-accession Assistance
  • At least one amongst the senior experts should have at least 5 years of experience in evaluation and/or management of programmes and/or projects to support civil society
  • Previous experience with PROSPECT and PADOR is an asset

The working language is English. Knowledge of Albanian, Serbian, Bosnian, Montenegrin, Macedonian and/or Turkish would be an advantage.

One of the Assessors (Senior Experts) will assume also the role of Team Leader.

If you meet the requirements and would be interested in applying for this role please email your CV in EC format to Aurelie_Durand@dai.com

WE ARE ONLY ABLE TO RESPOND TO CANDIDATES WHO MEET THE SPECIFICATIONS

item.title: AWP 2 Projects Review
item.author: Bryan Schuetz
item.description:
The Beyond WTO Program (B-WTO) was developed in response to a request from the Government of Vietnam (GoV) for donor support to help with managing economic integration and the transition to a market economy following WTO accession. The B-WTO goal is “to strengthen government’s capacity to manage the integration of Vietnam into the global economy and the transition of Vietnam to a socialist market economy”. The immediate objective is “implementation of priority policy actions from the GoV’s Action Plan to enhance Vietnam’s capacity to sustain pro-poor growth (GAP)”.

The remit of this project was a review of the 2nd annual work plan’s implementation (AWP2) of Phase 2 of the B-WTO in May 2013. The objectives of the review were to:

  • Evaluate the project implementation performance and project results relative to the logical framework targets and evaluation criteria.
  • Evaluate the results achieved at the Component and Program’s level according to the Monitoring and Evaluation (M&E) framework of the Program.
  • Identify lessons learned from implementation, make recommendations for the remaining duration of the program and the Independent Completion Report process.

item.title: Health Program M&E
item.author: Bryan Schuetz
item.description:
In partnership with the Ministry of Health (MoH), the Australian Government is scoping and piloting a new approach to engagement in the health sector in Timor-Leste. The program approach is innovative in several respects. Key program features are: a systems perspective; joint program oversight by MoH and Australian Government; an emphasis on capacity facilitation through coaching rather than an over-reliance on more traditional technical assistance approaches; ongoing processes of joint intervention design throughout implementation; and rapid cycles of evidence-informed adaptation. These will require significant investments in interactive, exploratory, and rigorous monitoring and evaluation, requiring support from an M&E Specialist that is comfortable with non-traditional M&E approaches.

The Health Program M&E Specialist worked with the Australian Government Timor-Leste Health Team to design an M&E system for Australia’s support to the health sector, that is aligned with the Ministry of Health’s draft Sector M&E Framework and consistent with Australian Aid Program M&E Standards. The primary purpose of the M&E System will be to support strategic management and ongoing improvement of the Australian Government - MoH partnership in the health sector.

item.title: Program 2013 Performance and Quality Mapping Exercise
item.author: Bryan Schuetz
item.description: AusAID’s PNG Program is looking to improve its performance and quality (P&Q) standards and systems. The purpose of this project was to map the PNG Program’s current P&Q capacity and systems, to address the risk of AusAID being unable to demonstrate results for its increased investments in PNG over the next four years. Over the last several years, the PNG Program has undertaken a number of M&E assessments and reviews which have identified key strengths and challenges within the program. This project was intended to pick up where these assessments left off. Through a desk review and consultations with sector teams, the Review Team were to distil key P&Q risks and issues for the PNG Program. The Review Team’s brief included the provision of recommendations on priority activities to support sector approaches to M&E, strengthen the Program’s ability to collect evidence, provide critical analysis and report on results.

item.title: Humanitarian Performance Assessment Framework
item.author: Bryan Schuetz
item.description:
AusAID required a consultant to assist with the development and finalisation of its Humanitarian Performance Assessment Framework. Development of a humanitarian monitoring and evaluation framework is a key commitment outlined in AusAID’s 2011 Humanitarian Action Policy (HAP) and its associated Implementation Plan. In line with the agency focus on results reporting, the HAP and HAP Implementation Plan commit AusAID to develop a monitoring and evaluation framework to support the initial performance assessment framework contained within the HAP and AusAID annual reporting under the Comprehensive Aid Policy Framework.

The key objective of this assignment was to build the Humanitarian program’s capacity for monitoring and reporting results by:

  • In consultation with AusAID’s Humanitarian team, redraft and finalise the Humanitarian Performance Assessment Framework, to ensure it provides a platform to:
  • Track implementation of key commitments in Australia’s 2011 Humanitarian Action Policy; and,
  • Establish a set of measurable humanitarian performance indicators (in addition to the two CAPF indicators) to enable AusAID to track achievements, lessons learned and to report on the results achieved from AusAID’s humanitarian work.

item.title: Review of Pacific Forum Compact Reporting
item.author: Bryan Schuetz
item.description: The purpose of the assignment was to examine country views of aid effectiveness and regional organisations expressed through Forum Compact reporting, particularly peer review of Forum Island Countries’ national development plan processes. The services provided included the preparation of a think piece which outlines key aid effectiveness issues arising from country reporting under the Compact reporting and discusses options for addressing these issues.

item.title: Health Program M&E Specialist
item.author: Bryan Schuetz
item.description:
In partnership with the Ministry of Health (MoH), the Australian Government is scoping and piloting a new approach to engagement in the health sector in Timor-Leste. The program approach is innovative in several respects. Key program features are: a systems perspective; joint program oversight by MoH and Australian Government; an emphasis on capacity facilitation through coaching rather than an over-reliance on more traditional technical assistance approaches; ongoing processes of joint intervention design throughout implementation; and rapid cycles of evidence-informed adaptation. These will require significant investments in interactive, exploratory, and rigorous monitoring and evaluation, requiring support from an M&E Specialist that is comfortable with non-traditional M&E approaches.

The Health Program M&E Specialist worked with the Australian Government Timor-Leste Health Team to design an M&E system for Australia’s support to the health sector, that is aligned with the Ministry of Health’s draft Sector M&E Framework and consistent with Australian Aid Program M&E Standards.
